title: Romania - Factors to watch on Oct. 17
text:
BUCHAREST, Oct 17 (Reuters) - Here are news stories, press reports and events to watch which may affect Romanian financial markets on Thursday.

DEBT TENDER

Romanian debt managers tender 100 million lei ($23.31 million) worth of Oct. 2034 bonds and 200 million lei ($46.62 million) of one-year treasury bills.

CEE MARKETS

Central European currencies and stocks struggled to find direction in early trade on Wednesday, with investors watching apprehensively as the clock ran down on negotiations over a possible Brexit deal.

VOLKSWAGEN

Romania initiated new talks with Volkswagen on Tuesday after the carmaker announced it had postponed a final decision on whether to build a new plant in Turkey, trade minister Stefan Radu Oprea was quoted as saying.
